author: The Telegraph
title: BA On Business prize draw: terms and conditions
text: 1. This prize draw is open to companies registered in the UK. Employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and British Airways PLC (“BA”), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw are not eligible to enter. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. A representative of an entrant company must submit their entry via www.telegraph.co.uk/britishairways and entry is restricted to one per company. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winner will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The name of the winning company can be obtained by sending a sae to British Airways On Business Winner, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Sunday, October 18, 2015. 6. The Promoter will contact the representative of the winning company by telephone or email within 14 days of the closing date of the prize draw. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 8. One winning company will win a 25cm x 4 columns advertisement in one issue of The Daily Telegraph on a date before December 31st, 2016, to be mutually agreed between the winning company’s representative and the Promoter. The winner has the choice of providing their own advertisement of having the Promoter design an advertisement for them. In the latter case, the winner agrees that the Promoter shall decide, at its own discretion, the design and sign-off process. 9. The advertisement will appear “run of paper” in a position to be determined solely by the Promoter. The Promoter’s terms and conditions of advertising shall apply and can be viewed here . 10. The prize is subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 11. The winner may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of BA and the Promoter. 12. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 13. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter. Accordingly the Promoter may, at its absolute discretion, vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 14. The Promoter has sole responsibility for the publication, administration and adjudication of the prize draw and for provision of the prize. 15. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT.
